output:
I'll start by understanding the existing codebase structure and then create the tick-detail-drawer component.

Let me also check the tick-header component for additional patterns, and look at the API types.

Now I have a good understanding of the patterns. Let me create the tick-detail-drawer component.

Now I need to register the component in main.ts.

Let me build the project to verify there are no TypeScript errors.

The build succeeds. Let me also run the TypeScript type check to be thorough.

No TypeScript errors. Now let me update the todo list and close the task.

Now let me add an epic note for future iterations.

Task [bfe] is complete. I created the `tick-detail-drawer` component at `internal/tickboard/ui/src/components/tick-detail-drawer.ts` with the following features:

**Component Properties:**
- `tick: Tick | null` - The tick to display
- `open: boolean` - Controls drawer visibility  
- `notesList: Note[]` - Parsed notes for display
- `blockerDetails: BlockerDetail[]` - Blockers with title/status
- `parentTitle?: string` - Optional parent epic title

**Features Implemented:**
- Shoelace `sl-drawer` with 420px width, slides from right
- Displays all tick fields: ID, title, type, priority, status, description
- Shows parent epic link (clickable)
- Shows blockers list with links and closed status strikethrough
- Displays labels as badges
- Notes section with author, timestamp, and text
- Created/updated/closed timestamps
- Emits `drawer-close` event on hide
- Emits `tick-link-click` event for navigation to other ticks
- Responsive: full width on mobile (<480px)
